subtitle: Will they ever go down?
title: BeginnerMom: Sore, swollen feet
content:
Brought you you by MAMA I thought I would get morning sickness, weird food
cravings and swollen breasts during pregnancy. I thought I would feel loving
and emotional – or different in some way. But I feel totally normal! Honestly
I can understand those girls who say that they didn’t even know they were
pregnant! If I hadn’t missed a period and gone to the clinic for a test, I
would never have known. No morning sickness. No cravings. I feel nothing. My
life just goes on as always. I can’t stand garlic though. We actually had to
throw out the garlic in the house because the smell is too much for me. Also,
I eat more than I used to. My mother complains because she isn’t used to me
eating so much. (But I think she’d complain if I didn’t eat enough too!) So
she fusses over me and I enjoy it. In fact I feel even better than I usually
do! My allergies seem to have disappeared – probably because of the good food
I am eating. I am still active. My friends and family are shocked that I am
still doing errands up to such a late date. But life continues, doesn’t it? I
haven’t gained too much weight and I only started showing late into my 5th
month. My worst symptom is the swollen feet! The baby is sitting more on my
left side so my left foot has swollen up to almost double its size. It looks
scary and ugly. I worry my feet will grow permanently and never go back to how
they looked before! **MAMA HELP: Swollen feet (edema) during pregnancy can get
worse as your due date nears. It may not be comfortable, but it’s harmless and
normal. It should ease up overnight. If it doesn’t, or if your hands or face
become puffy, visit your clinic for a check-up.**
